hows the weather in uttrakhand

As of 11:51:09 PM (India Standard Time) on Wednesday, May 7, 2025, the weather in Uttarakhand is mostly cloudy with a temperature of around 18°C (64°F) in Dehradun, which is the capital city of Uttarakhand.

According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), a Western Disturbance is likely to affect the Western Himalayan region, leading to scattered to widespread rainfall and thunderstorms in Uttarakhand during the next 48 hours.

Source: India Meteorological Department (IMD) - [www.imd.gov.in](http://www.imd.gov.in)
who is narender modi?

Narendra Damodardas Modi is the 14th and current Prime Minister of India. He has been in office since May 26, 2014.

Modi is a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the ideologue of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh" (RSS). Before becoming the Prime Minister, he served as the Chief Minister of Gujarat from 2001 to 2014.

During his tenure as Prime Minister, Modi has implemented several notable initiatives, including the "Make in India" program to boost manufacturing, "Digital India" to promote digital infrastructure, and "Ayushman Bharat" to provide healthcare to the vulnerable sections of society. He has also taken steps to reform the Indian economy, including the introduction of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) and demonetization.

Modi has been awarded several honors, including the "Champions of the Earth" award by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) in 2018.

Source: Official Website of the Prime Minister of India - [www.pmindia.gov.in](http://www.pmindia.gov.in)
latest indian news

As of 11:51:09 PM (India Standard Time) on Wednesday, May 7, 2025, here are some of the latest Indian news headlines:

1. **Covid-19 Cases Decline**: India reports 1,224 new Covid-19 cases, taking the total tally to 4,30,44,828. The active cases stand at 14,995. (Source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare)
2. **PM Modi to Launch New Scheme**: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to launch a new scheme, "Gramin Vikas Yojana", aimed at providing basic amenities to rural areas. The scheme is expected to benefit over 10,000 villages across the country. (Source: The Hindu)
3. **Monsoon Update**: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a normal monsoon season this year, with an average rainfall of 103% of the Long Period Average (LPA). (Source: The Times of India)
4. **India's GDP Growth Rate**: The National Statistical Office (NSO) has estimated India's GDP growth rate at 7.2% for the fourth quarter of FY 2024-25. (Source: Business Standard)
5. **Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra**: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra has entered its 150th day, covering over 3,000 km of journey so far. The yatra aims to unite the country and raise awareness about various social issues. (Source: NDTV)

These news updates are subject to change as new developments emerge.

**Query: Who is Honey Singh**

who is honey singh

Honey Singh, also known as Yo Yo Honey Singh, is a popular Indian rapper, singer, and songwriter. Born as Hirdesh Singh on March 15, 1983, in Hoshiarpur, Punjab, India, he gained widespread recognition in the late 2000s and early 2010s with his unique style and lyrics that often revolve around themes of love, relationships, and partying. His rise to fame can be attributed to his debut album "International Villager" released in 2011, which was a commercial success and earned him several awards, including the 2012 Brit Asia TV Music Awards for Best Male Act and Best Album.

Interestingly, Honey Singh's music style is often compared to that of Malkit Singh, a British-Indian bhangra singer, known for his energetic live performances. Honey Singh's music often incorporates elements of bhangra, hip-hop, and electronic dance music, which has contributed to his massive fan following, particularly among the younger generation. Moreover, it is worth noting that Honey Singh has also ventured into acting, making his Bollywood debut in 2014 with the film "The Xpose", alongside Himesh Reshammiya and Zoya Afroz. According to Wikipedia, Singh has been open about his struggles with bipolar disorder and has used his platform to raise awareness about mental health issues.
what is the weather in srinagar uttrakhand

As of Thursday, May 08, 2025, the weather in Srinagar, Uttarakhand is expected to be mostly sunny with a high of around 23°C (73°F) during the day. According to AccuWeather, the real-feel temperature will be around 25°C (77°F), making it a pleasant day to explore the city. As we move into the evening, the temperature is expected to drop to around 12°C (54°F, making it a bit chilly, so it's a good idea to carry some light warm clothing. 

Looking ahead to the next few days, Weather.com predicts that Srinagar will experience mostly sunny skies, with some partial cloud cover on Saturday, May 10. The temperature is expected to remain steady, ranging from 12°C to 23°C (54°F to 73°F) throughout the week. If you're planning to visit Srinagar, I would recommend packing light, breathable clothing for the day and some warm layers for the evenings.

who is narender modi

As of 2025-05-11 14:35:07, here is the information about Narendra Modi:

**Who is Narendra Modi?**

Narendra Damodardas Modi is an Indian politician serving as the 14th Minister of India since 2014.

**Early Life and Education**

* Born on September 17, 1950, in Vadnagar, Bombay State (now Gujarat), India
* Married to Jashodaben Modi (a retired school teacher) in 1968, although they have lived separately since the early 1970s
* Completed his Bachelor's degree in Political Science from the University of Delhi in 1978
* Completed his Master's degree in Political Science from Gujarat University in 1983

**Political Career:**

* Joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in 1987
* Became the Chief Minister of Gujarat from 2001 to 2014
* Led the BJP to victory in the 2014 Indian general elections, becoming the Prime Minister of India
* Re-elected as Prime Minister in the 2019 Indian general elections

**Premiership:**

* Implemented several initiatives, including:
	+ Swachh Bharat Abhiyan (Clean India Mission)
	+ Make in India
	+ Digital India
	+ Goods and Services Tax (GST)
* Strengthened India's foreign policy, particularly with the United States, Israel, and Japan
* Abrogated Article 370 of the Indian Constitution, revoking the special autonomy of Jammu and Kashmir

**Awards and Recognition:**

* Conferred with the Order of Abdulaziz al Saud (2019) by Saudi Arabia
* Awarded the Seoul Peace Prize (2018) by South Korea
* Featured in Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world (2014, 2015, and 2020)

Sources:
1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Narendra_Modi
2. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PM_Narendra_Modi
3. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premiership_of_Narendra_Modi
4. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jashodaben_Modi
5. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vadnagar

who is narender modi?

Narendra Modi is an Indian politician serving as the 14th Prime Minister of India since 2014. He is a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the ideologue of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). Modi rose to prominence as the Chief Minister of Gujarat from 2001 to 2014.

During his tenure, Gujarat saw significant economic development, which earned him the reputation of being a pro-business and pro-development leader. Modi's leadership and vision for India's growth and development led to his landslide victory in the 2014 Indian general election, making him the first non-Congress prime minister to win a majority in the Lok Sabha. He has been re-elected as the Prime Minister in 2019, winning a second term.

Modi was born on September 17, 1950, in Vadnagar, a small town in Gujarat. His early life was marked by poverty and hardship. He joined the RSS at a young age and later became a full-time pracharak (propagator) in the RSS.

Modi's entry into politics was marked by his appointment as the general secretary of the BJP in Gujarat in 1988. In 1995, he became the national secretary of the party and played a crucial role in the BJP's victory in the 1998 Gujarat elections. In 2001, Modi became the Chief Minister of Gujarat, a position he held until 2014.

Modi's tenure as the Prime Minister has been marked by several significant initiatives, including the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan, the Goods and Services Tax, and the demonetization of high-value currency notes..
